name: Hotel Menage

reviews.text: We stayed at Hotel Menage for a wedding. It was my husband and my 10 month old daughter. The hotel was very accommodating by giving us a crib, a microwave, a fridge, and a quiet room for our baby. The decor was nice - the bathroom was ok. We ordered room service from Kya in the hotel and the food was tasty but not hot. The appetizers were hot but our entrees were not. Our friends stayed in a suite and those were phenomenal. Very pretty. They had 2 wall mounted televisions, and large sitting area, and tile floors - which are a plus to me as far as cleanliness is concerned. The pool was nice (saltwater), but it was a little warm. Great for night swimming, but not very refreshing for daytime. I would stay here again, though I think they need to re-think their policy on charging their guests for parking.
reviews.title: Better than I expected based on the reviews.
Best hotel in Anaheim
reviews.text: I wanted to give this hotel the credit it deserves.I have stayed at a number of hotels in Anaheim and none of them come close to this hotel. The beds were beyond luxurious, the rooms were very clean, the plasma flat screen tv was amazing and the room was very quiet! I traveled with my 4 year old niece and mother and we all slept well. We also enjoyed the 24 hour pool. It was so nice to be able to swim no matter what time we returned from Disneyland. We did not walk to Disneyland because of the age of my niece, but it was definitely close enough to walk and the hotel has very easy access to Disney's parking structure. The staff was extremely nice from the valet parking attendants to the check in counter agents. I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

We were here for a week in mid june 2009 - I chose it on the basis of reviews on Trip Advisor but was sorely disappointed when we got there. The main problem is NOISE - the location of the hotel is between the interstate and a very busy main road in Anaheim. When I asked for the quietest room available (and I am not normally someone who needs silence) we were given a room not facing the I-5 and told that this would be the quietest. It was like sleeping next to the interstate most of the time as the walls are so thin, and really, how quiet can it be 25 yards from the busiest road in California -- to drown out the noise we used the equally noisy airconditioner - which at least was constant rather than the whoosh of cars and trucks.
reviews.title: Avoid

reviews.text: this is a cheap property which has a veneer of 'boutique' to it. Putting a flat panel TV in the small rooms doesn't make it 'boutique'. I have travelled extensively and this must rank as one of the worst places I have been in. Trip advisor reviews talked about the service (which we found was only average) and the food (which was nothing to write home about -- the first night we were at Kya - the restaurant in the hotel - and my kids were given sour milk. It was replaced with an apology, but we didn't bother going back.)
reviews.title: Our Stay at Hotel Menage- June 7-15' 2009

reviews.text: The pool is okay but hardly restful as on the other side of the wall is the interstate. Finally, on checking out I wasn't even asked if I had a nice stay -- just a perfunctory remark asking if my credit card could be used for the extras.
reviews.title: Awful service, awful room. Needs more than a coat of paint.

reviews.text: We were treated very well during entire stay. The friendliness of the staff is superb. The room was clean with a very comfortable bed. The shower heads are awesome, I probably took a longer shower due to this then I should have. The big plasma TV in the room was great. The mist bar near the pool is a great relaxing casual hangout with cool music, great place to hang out and meet people. The lobby is inviting with comfortable chairs and music. The food was excellent and reasonably priced. The service is polite and fast. The pool was very warm and clean. The big circular chairs near the pool is very comfortable, big enough for 2. I cannot say enough about the staff, the valet making sure we didn't get lost, the bar tender checking on me, the servers at K'ya restaurant were all very exceptional. Overall a great experience we hope to do again soon.
reviews.title: Great weekend spent with my family!

reviews.text: Tom (San Diego)
reviews.title: An undiscovered, reasonably priced gem of a hotel that has excellent service and is located close to Disney.

reviews.text: A frequent traveler
reviews.title: great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel lives up to its advertising. The staff was courteous, helpful and engaging. The room accommodated a king bed and sofa and both were quiet comfortable. Having the TV on the wall opened up the space and the desk area is designed for computers and work. The large size of the bath area was delightful. This pool area and nightly fireworks from Disney made this place ideal. It is close enough to Disney to walk, yet secluded from the noise and activity from the park.
reviews.title: Wonderful outdoor bar for happy hour

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from a 5 night stay at the Menage and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Linda at front desk was very helpful from the moment we checked in. We originally had 2 rooms next to each other and she suggested we change to one with a connecting door. It worked out perfect for our group of 8 (4 adults, 4 kids), we had a fridge put in our room so we just had breakfast in our room. The pool area was very resort like, our kids spent hours swimming in the warm pool after a hard day at Disney. The 1/2 price drinks and great bar food made our evening meals affordable and relaxing. We had one evening at the restaurant and the food was very good there as well. The rooms were totally fine, the bathroom was small, but the beds were really comfortable and clean.. Yes its noisy outside but you get used to it, we live in a small town backing onto a forest, so if I can sleep here with the noise anybody can. We previously stayed at the popular Howard Johnson's, but if you want a hotel that not only caters to children, then the Menage I think is better choice due to the on site restaurant and bar.
reviews.title: Amazing service - Perfect hotel

reviews.text: We stayed here 2 nights on a visit to Disneyland. It is a 15 minute walk over I-5 to the park. The hotel is in a noisy area right off the highway, but we had a relatively quiet room and with the a/c on, we slept well. The rooms are spartan, but clean and the beds were fine. The food in the hotel's restaurant was very good and very reasonable. The staff were very courteous and helpful. It was an excellent value for the price and we would stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice Three Star Hotel

reviews.text: We left my 6 year old granddaughters favorite sleep toy ( a $50 Build a Bear) in the room for the day while we were at Disney only to return and have it missing. After having her cry for 2 days I called and talked to the Weekend Manager about it and was told they would investigate and call me back. This never happened.
reviews.title: Take Your Belongings With You

reviews.text: Other than the above mention problem the location was a bit far for us to walk to Disney. We perhaps could have walked in the am but after a long day at the park a walk would have been too much. Shuttle transportation to and from Disney is available for $4 adult and $3 child.
reviews.title: The staff at the hotel were awsome!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel sits between two major roadways and the trafic noise was a big problem if you like a quite stay.
reviews.title: Left something to be desired...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel also charges guest $10.00 per day to park. I guess I am from the old school and paying guest should not have to pay additional money to park their car. If they need additional revenue this charge should be included in the cost of the room.
reviews.title: Honeymoon Suite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from Anaheim California and had a great vacation. We stayed at the Hotel Menage due to its location and price range. This hotel is an older hotel that has been remodeled with a funky vibe, from flowing sheers in sitting area, to blue ambiance lighting in bar area, with contrasting flickering red candles on bar counter. The tiki bar along side of the pool outdoors is a great spot to sit in the evenings and watch the Disneyland fireworks from next door. Our room was clean and spacious, with king size bed, and an air-conditioner that worked wonderfully. The K'Ya restaurant serves a great breakfast as well as a great main meal menu. Be sure to try the Calamari, it is very tasty. The lobby bar and the pool bar both serve happy hour menus from 4-7pm, with 1/2 price food and drink, awesome!! There is also a computer room that is free of charge to use day or night. It is in need of a couple desk lights as it is dim when trying to see the keyboards, but other than that "free to use" was great. The pool area was very clean with great tables and chairs, and "beds" to sit at or lay on. The pool was always in use, day and night. A 10 minute walk takes you to Disneyland Resort, while a 20 minute walk took you to The Garden Walk shopping area just past. Across from Disneyland are restaurants such as Mimi's, McDonald's, Subway, etc. It is a very pretty walk, all lit up at night, and very safe. BUT the very best thing about this Hotel was the people. Very friendly and very helpful. Look for Frank at the bar, he is the best. He will go out of his way to do whatever he can to make your evening pleasurable. He is a people person who makes contact with his customers and gets to know them. He even went as far as getting my husband 2 bottles of ginger-ale for a migraine headache when he was sick. He got us 2 bottles of water when he saw we were hot, AND picked out, himself, a very yummy entre for me to try on our last evening there...that being the calamari as stated before. This is not a 5 star hotel, nor does it claim to be. As reported, it is a 3 star BUT with 5 star people. If you go, say hi to Frank for me, from here in NS, Canada. Have a good one :)
reviews.title: Great experience at Hotel Menage

reviews.text: Hotel is the best place to watch the fireworks without being at Disneyland. We watched the fireworks in the pool after great day at the park. Loved the food at the restaurant.! Even my 3 picky teenagers loved it. Bed was comfotable with soft sheets. Really enjoyted the stay at the Hotel Menage. We would stay there again next time we are in Disneyland.
reviews.title: fireworks from the pool

reviews.text: After endless searching I booked this hotel after reading about it on Trip Advisor . It appealed to me as I was a single parent travelling with a child and didn't want to be totally stuck in family land. Best things about the hotel.. the front staff are SO friendly and helpful. The lobby and bar are very stylish and modern. The pool is really lovely, better than the photo on their website. Disneyland is about a 10 minute walk straight down the road. You have to cross a couple of roads but they have pedestrian crossings so it's perfectly safe. It was great to be so close to Dland as we could easily come home and have a swim and food and go back on nights it was open to 12.00. We ate breakfast there every day and as kids eat free this worked out very reasonable. Big breakfasts and endless coffee, Yay! There is a happy hour from 4 - 7 pm every night and all the bar food is half price so you can really save a fortune by eating this way and you can have it at the pool if you want .Note only Local beer and wine was half price- I didn't realise this till I was half way through my Spanish red. The rooms were smaller than they seem in the photos. Beds and pillows were super comfortable. No fridge but there is an ice bucket and a free ice machine. Coffee maker but no jug or tea making facilities. Directly over the road is a starbucks, taco bell and convenience store that sells beer and wine and odd bits of fruit. Take a corkscrew if you like to buy a bottle of wine. Overall I found Menage to be really lovely and the food bill for seven days was extremely reasonable which made it a doubly good reason to stay there. One slight bummer was that the spa was closed which meant the pool heating wasn't working either so I didn't swim at all as it was far too cold for me. They said it would be fixed within a few days and by the time I left the sign was out again saying it would be fixed within a week. i wonder if this is an ongoing problem. Re a previous trip advisor I specifically asked for quiet room. The pool music is loud and late and the highway noise is too so if you care about going to sleep early you might want to do the same.
reviews.title: Save money on food and walk to Disneyland from here.

reviews.text: Usually when we go to Disneyland we stay in Buena Park, but since I found a deal on this place for $25 more than we usually pay to stay in Buena Park, figured we'd give it a shot.
reviews.title: Motel Menage more like it!

reviews.text: If you want to know what a boutique hotel looks like check out the Kimpton group which has locations all over the US, based out of San Francisco.
reviews.title: The Hotel Menage in Anaheim is a great place to stay.

description: Experience the beauty of California in the freshest and most unique boutique hotel in the Anaheim and Disneyland resort district. Conveniently located (block away from Disneyland and 2 miles from the Convention Center), Hotel Menage is the place to see and be seen in Orange County. Enjoy our newly renovated 244 perfectly appointed guest rooms and suites, with 42" plasmas, 24 hr pool, fitness center, business center, and complimentary hi-speed wireless internet, award winning K'ya restaurant..."Create Your Experience..."
